ability_score.name: CON
ability_score.desc: How well one takes a hit, affects one's total hit points.

ability_score.name: STR
ability_score.desc: Ability to swing a weapon or move large objects, as well as general endurance.

ability_score.name: DEX
ability_score.desc: Ability to dodge, move quickly, and properly use some weapons.

ability_score.name: WIS
ability_score.desc: Ability to perceive and understand one's surroundings. Often used to resist spells. Used by some to cast spells.

ability_score.name: INT
ability_score.desc: Knowledge of the world, history, invention, and magic.

ability_score.name: CHA
ability_score.desc: Ability to handle people or other entities in a conversation. Used by some to cast spells.

class.long_desc: In faith and the miracles of the divine, many find a greater purpose. Called to serve powers beyond most mortal understanding, all priests preach wonders and provide for the spiritual needs of their people. Clerics are more than mere priests, though; these emissaries of the divine work the will of their deities through strength of arms and the magic of their gods.
class.name: Cleric
class.short_desc: Use faith and miracles to serve powers beyond mortal understanding.

class.long_desc: Fighters excel at combat—defeating their enemies, controlling the flow of battle, and surviving such sorties themselves. While their specific weapons and methods grant them a wide variety of tactics, few can match fighters for sheer battle prowess.
class.name: Fighter
class.short_desc: Exceptional battle prowess and tactical skill.

class.long_desc: While some druids might keep to the fringe of battle, allowing companions and summoned creatures to fight while they confound foes with the powers of nature, others transform into deadly beasts and savagely wade into combat. Druids worship personifications of elemental forces, natural powers, or nature itself. Typically this means devotion to a nature deity, though druids are just as likely to revere vague spirits, animalistic demigods, or even specific awe-inspiring natural wonders.
class.name: Druid
class.short_desc: Manipulate flora and fauna to their advantage.

class.long_desc: While universalist wizards might study to prepare themselves for any manner of danger, specialist wizards research schools of magic that make them exceptionally skilled within a specific focus. Yet no matter their specialty, all wizards are masters of the impossible and can aid their allies in overcoming any danger.
class.name: Wizard
class.short_desc: Use their intelligence to control the universe.

race.short_desc: Well-rounded and lucky. Humans are known for their charisma, their skill in the market, and and their penchant for exploration.
race.name: Human

race.short_desc: Dextrous, wise, and magical. Elves have keen eyes and a special affinity for nature.
race.name: Elf

race.short_desc: Tough, wise, and knowledgeable of the metals of the earth.
race.name: Dwarf

racial_feats.desc: Select 1 additional skill rank per level.
racial_feats.name: Skilled

racial_feats.desc: Add +2 to your choice of ability score.
racial_feats.name: Human Versatility

racial_feats.desc: Immune to magic sleeps effects. Gain +2 to saving throws against enchantment spells and effects.
racial_feats.name: Elven Immunities

racial_feats.desc: +2 to overcome spell resistance. +2 to identify magic items.
racial_feats.name: Elven Magic

racial_feats.desc: Proficient with longbows, longswords, rapiers, and shortbows. Treat elven weapons as martial weapons.
racial_feats.name: Weapon Familiarity (Elven)

racial_feats.desc: See twice as far as humans in dim light.
racial_feats.name: Low-Light Vision

racial_feats.desc: +2 on saving throws against poison or spells.
racial_feats.name: Hardy

racial_feats.desc: +4 to resististing tripping or a bull rush.
racial_feats.name: Stability

racial_feats.desc: +2 to Appraise checks on nonmagical precious goods.
racial_feats.name: Greed

racial_feats.desc: +2 to Perception to notice unusual stonework, indicating traps or hidden doors. Recieve a check to notice such features when within 10 feet of them, even if not looking.
racial_feats.name: Stonecunning

racial_feats.desc: Can see perfectly in the dark up to 60 feet.
racial_feats.name: Darkvision

racial_feats.desc: +1 to attack rolls against orc or goblinoid creatures.
racial_feats.name: Hatred

racial_feats.desc: Proficient with battleaxes, heavy picks, and warhammers. Treat dwarven weapons as martial weapons.
racial_feats.name: Weapon Familiarity (Dwarven)

skill.long_desc: You can keep your balance while traversing narrow or treacherous surfaces. You can also dive, flip, jump, and roll, avoiding attacks and confusing your opponents.
skill.name: Acrobatics

skill.long_desc: You can evaluate the monetary value of an object.
skill.name: Appraise

skill.long_desc: You know how to tell a lie.
skill.name: Bluff

skill.long_desc: You are skilled at scaling vertical surfaces, from smooth city walls to rocky cliffs.
skill.name: Climb

skill.long_desc: You are skilled in the creation of a specific group of items, such as armor or weapons. Like Knowledge, Perform, and Profession, Craft is actually a number of separate skills. You could have several Craft skills, each with its own ranks. The most common Craft skills are alchemy, armor, baskets, books, bows, calligraphy, carpentry, cloth, clothing, glass, jewelry, leather, locks, paintings, pottery, sculptures, ships, shoes, stonemasonry, traps, and weapons. A Craft skill is specifically focused on creating something. If nothing is created by the endeavor, it probably falls under the heading of a Profession skill.
skill.name: Craft

skill.long_desc: You can use this skill to persuade others to agree with your arguments, to resolve differences, and to gather valuable information or rumors from people. This skill is also used to negotiate conflicts by using the proper etiquette and manners suitable to the problem.
skill.name: Diplomacy

skill.long_desc: You are skilled at disarming traps and opening locks. In addition, this skill lets you sabotage simple mechanical devices, such as catapults, wagon wheels, and doors.
skill.name: Disable Device

skill.long_desc: You are skilled at changing your appearance.
skill.name: Disguise

skill.long_desc: Your training allows you to slip bonds and escape from grapples.
skill.name: Escape Artist

skill.long_desc: You are skilled at flying, either through the use of wings or magic, and you can perform daring or complex maneuvers while airborne. Note that this skill does not give you the ability to fly.
skill.name: Fly

skill.long_desc: You are trained at working with animals, and can teach them tricks, get them to follow your simple commands, or even domesticate them.
skill.name: Handle Animal

skill.long_desc: The DC and effect depend on the task you attempt.
skill.name: Heal

skill.long_desc: You can use this skill to frighten your opponents or to get them to act in a way that benefits you. This skill includes verbal threats and displays of prowess.
skill.name: Intimidate

skill.long_desc: Arcana (ancient mysteries, magic traditions, arcane symbols, constructs, dragons, magical beasts); Although robots are constructs, Knowledge (arcana) cannot be used to identify robots or their abilities and weaknesses. You are educated in a field of study and can answer both simple and complex questions. Like the Craft, Perform, and Profession skills, Knowledge actually encompasses a number of different specialties.
skill.name: Knowledge (Arcana)

skill.long_desc: Dungeoneering (aberrations, caverns, oozes, spelunking). You are educated in a field of study and can answer both simple and complex questions. Like the Craft, Perform, and Profession skills, Knowledge actually encompasses a number of different specialties.
skill.name: Knowledge (Dungeoneering)

skill.long_desc: (buildings, aqueducts, bridges, fortifications); This is the most important skill with regard to technological subjects. Knowledge (engineering) can be used to identify a robot’s abilities and weaknesses. Knowledge (engineering) is also used to identify and understand unknown technological objects in a similar manner to how Spellcraft is used to identify the properties of a magic item. The DC to correctly identify and understand an unknown technological object is equal to the object’s Craft DC. An object with a Craft DC of 15 or less can be automatically identified and understood by someone trained in Knowledge (engineering) who also has the Technologist feat. You are educated in a field of study and can answer both simple and complex questions. Like the Craft, Perform, and Profession skills, Knowledge actually encompasses a number of different specialties.
skill.name: Knowledge (Engineering)

skill.long_desc: (lands, terrain, climate, people); Used for astronomy. You are educated in a field of study and can answer both simple and complex questions. Like the Craft, Perform, and Profession skills, Knowledge actually encompasses a number of different specialties.
skill.name: Knowledge (Geography)

skill.long_desc: (wars, colonies, migrations, founding of cities). You are educated in a field of study and can answer both simple and complex questions. Like the Craft, Perform, and Profession skills, Knowledge actually encompasses a number of different specialties.
skill.name: Knowledge (History)

skill.long_desc: (legends, personalities, inhabitants, laws, customs, traditions, humanoids). You are educated in a field of study and can answer both simple and complex questions. Like the Craft, Perform, and Profession skills, Knowledge actually encompasses a number of different specialties.
skill.name: Knowledge (Local)

skill.long_desc: (animals, fey, monstrous humanoids, plants, seasons and cycles, weather, vermin). You are educated in a field of study and can answer both simple and complex questions. Like the Craft, Perform, and Profession skills, Knowledge actually encompasses a number of different specialties.
skill.name: Knowledge (Nature)

skill.long_desc: (lineages, heraldry, personalities, royalty). You are educated in a field of study and can answer both simple and complex questions. Like the Craft, Perform, and Profession skills, Knowledge actually encompasses a number of different specialties.
skill.name: Knowledge (Nobility)

skill.long_desc: (the Inner Planes, the Outer Planes, the Astral Plane, the Ethereal Plane, outsiders, planar magic). You are educated in a field of study and can answer both simple and complex questions. Like the Craft, Perform, and Profession skills, Knowledge actually encompasses a number of different specialties.
skill.name: Knowledge (Planes)

skill.long_desc: (gods and goddesses, mythic history, ecclesiastic tradition, holy symbols, undead). You are educated in a field of study and can answer both simple and complex questions. Like the Craft, Perform, and Profession skills, Knowledge actually encompasses a number of different specialties.
skill.name: Knowledge (Religion)

skill.long_desc: You are skilled at working with language, in both its spoken and written forms. You can speak multiple languages, and can decipher nearly any tongue given enough time. Your skill in writing allows you to create and detect forgeries as well.
skill.name: Linguistics

skill.long_desc: Your senses allow you to notice fine details and alert you to danger. Perception covers all five senses, including sight, hearing, touch, taste, and smell.
skill.name: Perception

skill.long_desc: You are skilled at one form of entertainment, from singing to acting to playing an instrument. Like Craft, Knowledge, and Profession, Perform is actually a number of separate skills. You could have several Perform skills, each with its own ranks.
skill.name: Perform

skill.long_desc: You are skilled at a specific job. Like Craft, Knowledge, and Perform, Profession is actually a number of separate skills. You could have several Profession skills, each with its own ranks. While a Craft skill represents ability in creating an item, a Profession skill represents an aptitude in a vocation requiring a broader range of less specific knowledge.
skill.name: Profession

skill.long_desc: You are skilled at riding mounts, usually a horse, but possibly something more exotic, like a griffon or pegasus. If you attempt to ride a creature that is ill suited as a mount, you take a –5 penalty on your Ride checks.
skill.name: Ride

skill.long_desc: You are skilled at detecting falsehoods and true intentions.
skill.name: Sense Motive

skill.long_desc: Your training allows you to pick pockets, draw hidden weapons, and take a variety of actions without being noticed.
skill.name: Sleight of Hand

skill.long_desc: You are skilled at the art of casting spells, identifying magic items, crafting magic items, and identifying spells as they are being cast.
skill.name: Spellcraft

skill.long_desc: You are skilled at avoiding detection, allowing you to slip past foes or strike from an unseen position. This skill covers hiding and moving silently.
skill.name: Stealth

skill.long_desc: You are skilled at surviving in the wild and at navigating in the wilderness. You also excel at following trails and tracks left by others.
skill.name: Survival

skill.long_desc: You know how to swim and can do so even in stormy water.
skill.name: Swim

skill.long_desc: You are skilled at activating magic items, even if you are not otherwise trained in their use.
skill.name: Use Magic Device

spell.name: Acid Arrow
spell.desc: An arrow of acid springs from your hand and speeds to its target. You must succeed on a ranged touch attack to hit your target. The arrow deals 2d4 points of acid damage with no splash damage. For every three caster levels you possess, the acid, unless neutralized, lasts for another round (to a maximum of 6 additional rounds at 18th level), dealing another 2d4 points of damage in each round.

spell.name: Acid Fog
spell.desc: Acid fog creates a billowing mass of misty vapors like the solid fog spell. In addition to slowing down creatures and obscuring sight, this spell's vapors are highly acidic. Each round on your turn, starting when you cast the spell, the fog deals 2d6 points of acid damage to each creature and object within it.

spell.name: Aid
spell.desc: Aid grants the target a +1 morale bonus on attack rolls and saves against fear effects, plus temporary hit points equal to 1d8 + caster level (to a maximum of 1d8+10 temporary hit points at caster level 10th).

spell.name: Resistance
spell.desc: You imbue the subject with magical energy that protects it from harm, granting it a +1 resistance bonus on saves.
